Citation Text: We were interested in the occurrence of features such as type and number of premodifiers, presence and type of post modifiers, and form of name reference for people. Citation Text: The levels of accuracy and robustness recently achieved by statistical parsers (e.g. Collins (1999), Charniak (2000)) have led to their use in a number of NLP applications, such as question-answering (Pasca and Harabagiu, 2001), machine translation (Charniak et al, 2003), sentence simplification (Carroll et al, 1999), and a linguist? s search engine (Resnik and Elkiss, 2003)

Citation Text: The parser of Charniak (2000) is also a two-stage ctf model, where the first stage is a smoothed Markov grammar (it uses up to three previous constituents as context), and the second stage is a lexicalized Markov grammar with extra annotations about parents and grandparents
